item.title: Covid: Countries send aid to ease India's oxygen emergency
item.description: The UK is sending oxygen machines and ventilators while France and the US are also sending supplies.

item.title: India Covid: Patients struggle at home as hospitals choke
item.description: India's Covid sick struggle to get treatment at home due to black marketing of oxygen and drugs.

item.title: Post office scandal: Ex-boss quits director role after convictions quashed
item.description: Paula Vennells to leave her role at Dunelm days after 39 postmasters saw their convictions quashed.

item.title: Covid-19: Vaccine rollout in England extends to 44-year-olds
item.description: The NHS plans to set out when 40 to 43-year-olds will be invited for the jab "in the coming days".

item.title: Labour: Ministers must reveal Covid contract links
item.description: Emergency measures to speed up government procurement has led to accusations of a "VIP fast track".

item.title: Boris Johnson covered Downing Street flat renovation from his own pocket, says Liz Truss
item.description: However Liz Truss will not say if a Conservative donor provided the money to Boris Johnson first.

item.title: Indonesian navy submarine found split into three on sea bed
item.description: The shattered hull of the vessel is found on the sea bed off Bali and all 53 crew are confirmed dead.

item.title: Ashley Cain's daughter Azaylia dies aged 8 months
item.description: She was diagnosed with an aggressive form of leukaemia when she was eight weeks old.

item.title: Scottish election 2021: Sturgeon faces questions over 'hard border'
item.description: The SNP leader wants trade to flow freely between Scotland and England if an independent Scotland re-joins the EU.

item.title: German opera star Christa Ludwig dies at the age of 93
item.description: The singer was closely associated with the Vienna State Opera for most of her long career.

item.title: Carabao Cup final: Manchester City 1-0 Tottenham Hotspur - Aymeric Laporte heads winner
item.description: Manchester City win the Carabao Cup for the fourth successive season as Aymeric Laporte's late header beats Tottenham Hotspur.

item.title: The Papers: 'PM under pressure' and 'India at breaking point'
item.description: Several front pages continue to focus on questions facing Boris Johnson over the renovation of his Downing Street flat.

item.title: Oscars 2021: The railway station now a hosting venue
item.description: Union Station in Los Angeles will be one of the venues for this year's Oscars.

item.title: Man jumps through car window to stop dangerous driver in Albania
item.description: A suspect was arrested after breaking through barriers in a pedestrianised zone in the Albanian capital.

item.title: How Armel Zola is helping people to 'stay positive' at home
item.description: The former footballer is teaching dancing in lockdown to young adults with Down's Syndrome.

item.title: Brazil: Environment police battle for Amazon rainforest
item.description: Riots, policy changes and funding cuts have all threatened the mission to preserve the rainforest.

item.title: Oscars 2021: 'I don't mind being the underdog'
item.description: Irish animation studio Cartoon Saloon's latest film Wolfwalkers is up for an Oscar on Sunday night.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'fences'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers on this week's theme.

item.title: US Dragon spaceship arrives at International Space Station
item.description: SpaceX's Dragon Endeavour spacecraft has docked with the International Space Station.

item.title: The real-life nomads of Nomadland
item.description: Meet the Americans whose lives on the road inspired the Oscar-nominated film.

item.title: Downing Street flat refurbishment: What is the row all about?
item.description: Boris Johnson is facing questions over how expensive works on his Downing Street flat were paid for.

item.title: Oscars 2021: The nominations in full
item.description: The films, actors, directors and production talent who are in the running for golden statuettes.

item.title: Afghanistan War: How can the West fight terrorism after leaving?
item.description: As Western troops prepare to go, there are concerns over the future of counter-terrorism operations.

item.title: The Voice: Grace Holden tells of opening up about her grief
item.description: Grace Holden found talking about her mum's death hard - until she opened up about it on The Voice.

item.title: Deaths climb as India reels from deadly Covid wave
item.description: Heart-wrenching images from crematoriums across the country capture the true toll of the virus.

item.title: Screen time at 'breaking point' but can tech help?
item.description: There is growing evidence notifications and too much screen time can reduce attention and productivity.

item.title: European Super League: 'A seismic, pivotal week in football - but game not yet over'
item.description: BBC sports editor Dan Roan looks back at a 'seismic and pivotal' launch and crash of the European Super League, and what might happen next.

item.title: Q&A: Armenian genocide dispute
item.description: What was the Armenian "genocide" and why is it still such a sensitive issue?

item.title: It's the Oscars 2021 - but how many people have seen the main films?
item.description: This year's Academy Awards take place on Sunday, with a largely low-key crop of contenders.

item.title: St Johnstone knock Rangers out of Scottish Cup on penalties
item.description: Zander Clark is St Johnstone's hero as he saves two spot-kicks as the Perth side knock Rangers out of the Scottish Cup on penalties at Ibrox.

item.title: Aston Villa 2-2 West Bromwich Albion: Keinan Davis scores 92nd minute equaliser
item.description: West Brom's faint hopes of avoiding relegation suffer a significant setback after substitute Keinan Davis scored a 92nd minute equaliser for Aston Villa.

item.title: Carabao Cup: Players and pundits revel in fans' return at Wembley
item.description: Players, fans and pundits alike rejoice at the return of supporters on the "day football came off mute".

item.title: World Snooker Championship: Judd Trump and Stuart Bingham build commanding second-round leads
item.description: Ex-champions Judd Trump and Stuart Bingham take commanding leads into the final sessions of their respective second-round games.

item.title: British teenager Gadirova caps brilliant week with European floor gold
item.description: Teenager Jessica Gadirova caps a brilliant week at the European Gymnastics Championships with gold in the floor event.

item.title: Bielsa sees signs of Leeds 'evolution' as stubborn display frustrates Man Utd
item.description: Leeds take points off one of the 'Big Six' for the third Premier League game running as they hold Manchester United to a goalless draw.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: People 45 or over in England are being offered a Covid vaccine.

item.title: Covid: When can I go on holiday abroad or in the UK?
item.description: A traffic light system ranking foreign countries by coronavirus risk is to be introduced - the rules on UK holidays are also easing.

item.title: Covid: Which areas are being mass tested for variants?
item.description: People who live, work or travel through two south London boroughs are being urged to take a Covid-19 test.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Which countries are on the red list and what are the quarantine rules?
item.description: India has now been added to the UK Government's Covid "red list" of countries.

item.title: India Covid crisis: Did election rallies help spread virus?
item.description: Did campaigning for state elections in India help coronavirus to spread?

item.title: Covid: Restaurants and pubs are reopening, but what are the rules?
item.description: Pubs, cafes and restaurants will reopen in Wales and Scotland on Monday 26 April.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: A nightmare on repeat - India is running out of oxygen again
item.description: Facing a rising wave of coronavirus, and record case numbers, India finds itself battling for breath.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: The number of people allowed to meet in Wales is changing - and you can now get a haircut in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 33 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk on transport?
item.description: As UK coronavirus restrictions continue to be relaxed, public transport could become much busier.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: What is a Covid passport and what are the UK's plans?
item.description: The government is considering how people could prove they are unlikely to transmit Covid.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Teams around the world are looking into medicines for Covid-19 and scientists are starting to discover what works.

item.title: Is the Australia-NZ travel bubble the way ahead?
item.description: Australia and New Zealand have quarantine-free travel, but will other countries follow their lead?

item.title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: Covid: When will children return to school and what are the rules?
item.description: Children are returning to school across the UK, after months of enforced home-schooling.

item.title: 'My sister took her life, petrified at facing her ex in court'
item.description: Gemma Robinson died just days before she was due to see her ex-partner in court.

item.title: The disabled doctors not believed by their colleagues
item.description: People often feel nervous when they visit a doctor, but what if you are a doctor but your colleagues don't believe you're ill?

item.title: The homeless drug addict who became a professor
item.description: Jesse Thistle, a high school dropout, overcame addiction and homelessness to pursue an academic career.

item.title: Nil-by-mouth foodie: The chef who will never eat again
item.description: Loretta Harmes hasn't eaten or tasted food for six years, but she hasn't lost her passion for cooking.

item.title: Why are so many babies dying of Covid-19 in Brazil?
item.description: As the pandemic rages in Brazil, hundreds of babies and young children are dying of Covid.

item.title: Prince Philip: A turbulent childhood stalked by exile, mental illness and death
item.description: In marrying, Philip was able to regain the "simple pleasures" of family life he had lost aged eight.
